body:
Comment 9: 
There's a difference.  If I import the same package under two different import paths
using directory hard-links then it is _my_ decision to have different import paths.  But
with package main, it is the _runtime_ that is currently deciding to import it under
different names depending on whether it is built as a command or a package (a decision
criteria which is not relevant -- in fact, there should be no decision, just return the
real import path).

Why does the runtime import it as "main"?  It makes much more sense to import it with
its true import path.

You are using the current behavior to justify the current behavior.
